Reviews.Title: “Honest deals - no hassle - no unwanted extras”
Reviews.Author: Tonythemonk
Reviews.Content: We did not stay in this hotel, but did eat in the restaurant. This is one of the few eating places in Istanbul where you get "what is said on the tin" and you are not billed for "extras" which you did not ask for. The food was of a very high quality and very reasonably priced. The wine was extremely well priced for Istanbul with a litre bottle of a reasonable quality white wine only costing 45TL. The Hotel looks very comfortable and full of character, and the staff are very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “An openhearted hotel with a very special character.”
Reviews.Author: Valery_and_Lena
Reviews.Content: This hotel really has the local spirit! Its interior looks like a mix of old Turkish style with old Turkish-European...whatever it means. The location is the best you can get in Istanbul - 100 metres from the very middle of the Old Centre. Nice touristic area around with good restaurants and main historical attractions. The staff is very friendly and compassionate. They really seem to love what they are doing, put their soul into this business. You will find a great variety of real antique things around, lamps, furniture. Besides fantastic rooms all of which are unique, the hotel has its own authentic restaurant, a cozy library, a huge museum of antique, a suprisingly sunny and fun inner yard and attractive shops. What is more important you can walk everywhere you want, sit for hours in the gorgeous cafe downstairs, talk to the friendly owner, read a book, watch the passers-by and at the same time really feel at home. And for those who are a bit worried about going to "Asia" - this hotel (as well as much as rest of the city) is in fact quite developed in service: English speaking staff, Wi-Fi, safety lockers at reception, regular cleaning, etc. The main disadvantages are other guests (as usual) and expensive price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good price, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: philippeenrique
Reviews.Content: We have spent one night at this hotel, ideally located close to the Blue Mosk, the Grand Baazar, etc. Very different, nicely decorated, very original. And most of it, the staff is just amazing. Go and see "Mike", the owner of the hotel and he will receive you in his room, which looks like the back of a carpet store, plenty of nice and original stuff and he will tell you great stories about him, but also Istanbul. Quite magic.

Reviews.Title: “Place to go!”
Reviews.Author: Lozerienbest
Reviews.Content: The Kybele Hotel is a real typpical Turkish Hotel, it's situated near to the Aya Sofia, The Sultanhamet and theTopkapi Palace. It's situated in a quiet street. It also has a Restaurant with good food. The staff is Very Friendly and helpful. The whole hotel is full with little Turkish Lamps, which creates a very nice athmosphere. It's really a placfe to go ! Try !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: You'll never find a nicer hotel in Istanbul. Apart from the convenience of it's locality, being within walking distance to the major historical attractions, the staff are friendly and extremely helpful, the food is the best, the rooms are comfortable, clean and interestingly decorated with antique furnishings. The eclectic roof patio is the place to rest in quiet tranquility or eat your meals. Altogether a colourful and wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “I'd love to return”
Reviews.Author: Mariangela B
Reviews.Content: Cannot say anything more than excellent: nice and clean rooms, all with air conditioned perfect location (next to Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and Basilica Cisterna) Good food (even not the best I had in 2 weeks in Turkey) nice tables in front of the hotel where to spend the last hours of the day drinking an tea Strongly suggest to go there

Reviews.Title: “Charming, authentic, and well located”
Reviews.Author: Vivianite
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kybele is not where you want to stay if you want an anonymous, modern, chain-hotel type of lodging, a hotel that has no hint of the rich, gritty, beautiful, real, historical jewel of a city that is Istanbul. From the moment you set foot in the colorful and lively hotel you KNOW you are in Istanbul. The walls in deep reds and golds, antique chairs and sofas elbowing each other for space, furnishings and artwork(hanging glass lanterns of various shapes, colors, and sizes throng the ceilings of the public rooms and the room I stayed in) , to the slightly bewildering arrangement of rooms, staircases, and corridors (a sort of mini-version of the Grand Bazaar), all contribute to the authentic ambience of the place. A friend and I stayed in Hotel Kybele. Her room had a wonderful city view. My room, with its deep red wallpaper and jewel-toned lanterns on the ceiling, had a quiet, cozy garden view. The overall effect is one of careworn, casual opulence.... shabby chic of the Turkish variety. The two young men at the desk were very helpful, friendly, and accommodating. All the members of the staff I dealt with were pleasant and happy to be of service. The hotel is very conveniently located, within walking distance of wonderful restaurants and the major sights and monuments of the historic European center of the city. I highly recommend Hotel Kybele to those on the lookout for boutique hotels and inns of character, charm, and local color when they travel.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice to go there”
Reviews.Author: Jodhy
Reviews.Content: Once we arrived in the hotel about 9am, becauss check out time there is 11am, then we must wait till room is ready. Before we get a room, we were walking around old city, then we come back about 11am. I thought we will get a room, but then we have to wait till we get a room about 2pm. So from this vase, you should not expect get room automatically. After we get room, we found no tv there and the room is very small or tight. Even for bathroom and shower. The room looks small cuz many lamps hang on ceil. One night we use that room, then we move to room bigger than previous, but same no tv, small bathroom, looks tight, only nice you have balcony for smoking (for smoker) as all room are non smoking room. And this hotel doesnt have lift even it has 3 floors. The rate of Room also more expensive to other hotel i stay after. Nice thing for this hotel, they have friendly staff, especially driver of private car who legally for hotel guest.

Reviews.Title: “Most PERFECT hotel and location for Istanbul 2 day trip”
Reviews.Author: Squirreltoofies
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul recently with my fiancÃ©e, and we had a GREAT time. It was in an absolutely perfect location, very short walks to Topkapi Square, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and literally on the same block as the Cistern. Unbelievably quirky and quaint...room was a "small double" and was just fine since we really only slept there. All rooms, hallways, lounges have lit lantern lights hanging from the ceiling. Like hundreds of them. Sets a great mood! Bathroom in the room was spacious, and super clean. Breakfast included, and there were lots of small sitting areas on different levels of the hotel that made it magical. As for food, we loved it. We went (on the same block) to two restaurants, one was called Medusa -- and they had great food (not so cheap) and a fantastic musical trio playing Turkish music. We also went to a restaurant next to the hotel that was really good, though I forgot the name. Great food, great hotel, friendly/helpful people all over. A must if you've not been already!!!

Reviews.Title: “The coolest place to stay in Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: JoozUK
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in Istanbul and I am still buzzing from the experience! Right in the centre of Sultanahmet and in the best location, the Kybele has to be the coolest place I have ever stayed in - it should be listed as as an attraction in itself! Soooo quirky, charming, Bohemian and utterly unique - from the vibrant colours of the exterior, to the hundreds and hundreds of lanterns hanging from the ceilings, to the maze of rooms and staircases, to Mike's(the owner)' Museum' - a cross between a hippy chillout den and an Aladdin's cave of , well just about everything you could imagine! Our room (504 - with a double bed, a single bed and a fab window seat)was so comfortable and beautifully decorated and best of all sooo quiet - it is at the back overlooking the little courtyard area and we had no outside/inside noise at all - oh, apart from the obvious seagulls and call to prayer!.The food was great, the staff were soooo helpful (Mike's fabulous son even helped us to book VIP tickets to go see Ricky Martin who opened his European tour in Istanbul on saturday night!) and warm hearted and we were treated like family. I really cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and will definitely be returning. Please do ask any questions as I can talk about this amazing place all day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and friendly”
Reviews.Author: travellingfoodie53
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days and was treated very well. I asked for a room with a view and was given one with the terrace on the top floor. Room was small by Australian standards but the bed was really comfortable & bathroom spotless.Staff were helpful & friendly. Loved their food, good size portions and the local red wine was good. They serve fabulous chocolate baklava. Perfect location for getting around Istanbul. If you want local colour instead of boring corporate stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Kim-Phil
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after we were double booked in the Celel Sultan nearby. Our room's ceiling was full of small hanging lights with glass shades - certainly different! However the room was a bit small with a double and a single bed in it and a very small ensuite - the width of the shower cubicle and only room for 1 at a time. No lift. We had a drink in the bar which was very relaxing and again the ceiling was full of the lights. We didn't eat in the hotel and slept ok. No view to speak of from the window and the bed was pushed right next to the wall. Interesting to have a drink here but not a great place to stay, especially after comparing it to the Celal Sultan.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but would not come back again”
Reviews.Author: DrEitan
Reviews.Content: Certainly the location is excellent. However, the rooms were small. It had a musty old smell. Its not a hotel for families with children. Great spot for singles or couples. Staff were nice but one particularly fellow had a "stuck up" attitude. Overall, I was not terribly impressed. Just as I stated, its adequate but not a spot to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ambiance”
Reviews.Author: zenbremenzen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel on our long weekend trip to Ä°stanbul,was a wonderful stay,very clean,quite,a great value,very friendly staff were very helpful on every aspect of our trip. We highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Jneuvel
Reviews.Content: This is a great place with a superb atmosphere. The place makes you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Dinner”
Reviews.Author: Doxielvr
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent five nights at the Kybele, first in one room and then moving to a larger room. We were very pleased with this hotel. We thought the breakfast had more variety than other places we stayed (we loved the addition of soup for breakfast). We found the staff incredibly helpful and pleasant. A drawback was climbing three stories to our room but one can't expect elevators in these classic Istanbul buildings and we managed. As others have written, the price was a little higher than might be expected but it is a perfect location for seeing the normal tourist spots and many less touristy sites. We did a lot of walking and the restaurant in the Kybele was very welcome when we dragged back to the hotel, too tired to go elsewhere for dinner--and the everything we ate was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Will be definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: roadsidedoha
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked to see this place so low in the Trip Advisor rankings, but I suppose I get it. With Kybele, what you pay for is the location, character - a completely unique space, and the chance to interact the most knowledgeable and hospitable staff Turkey has to offer. You're not paying for plush, luxurious accommodations. My husband and I loved it - the staff here/this hotel really made our trip to Istanbul. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Magical hotel in the heart of old Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: mollymooper
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a charming hotel in the heart of old istanbul within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sofia, the underground cistern, the grand bazar and the spice market, then this is the place for you. The hotel is easily accessible from the metro from Ataturk Interational Airport which will save you a bit of money on taxis. And although the hotel isn't cheap, it's completely worth the price because of its central location and charm. The rooms are decorated very beautifully and the staff is responsive to any concerns or questions you might have. We found that the staff went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and happy during our stay. The reservation and booking manager is also extremely professional and quick to respond. Overall, this hotel was an excellent choice and well worth the cost. And there is also a very nice breakfast spread included which you can eat sitting at a table outside on the side of the quaint streets of the old town.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Istanbul hotel - the best”
Reviews.Author: dianesavona
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect: a gorgeous hotel, lovely rooms, amazing character, great location. Not cheap, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: KPDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kybele for 4 nights and cannot imagine staying anywhere else. This charming hotel is situated in the heart of the old part of town, steps from the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. The lobby is decorated with antiques as are the rooms. I was really surprised at how clean and orderly everything was. There were 4 of us in a room which was somewhat cramped but manageable. We initially had the triple room with a cot which really was challenging to fit our suitcases in but we switched to the family room with 2 balconies which was very spacious and even had a sitting area. We were really surprised at how comfortable the beds were. The showers were adequate but we had quite a few temperature fluctuations. Bring shampoo/conditioner/lotion if you are picky. They have disposers in the shower but the quality is iffy. We never heard any noise from the other guests to the walls must be pretty thick. There are no elevators so if you have issues with steps, better look elsewhere. Breakfast is included in the price and was exactly what you would expect. We ate dinner here twice and were really pleased with the quality of the food and the service. The staff at this hotel really enhanced our stay. They were so friendly and helpful. We felt like they were family by the end of our stay. The owner also owns the boutique and rug store next door. We purchased 5 rugs from him and feel that we got great quality rugs for a fair price (no bartering). I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to return myself one day. On a side note, I would NOT recommend the Turkish Mytic Music and Dance - total waste of money and time. We did enjoy a turkish bath at the Suleymanie Hamam which appeared very clean and was a unique experience. Instead of a tourist cruise up the Bosphoros we took the public ferry which was really cheap and a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home... Only Cooler. Slice Of Turkish Heaven”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkChuck
Reviews.Content: On my last visit to Istanbul in 2007, we had dinner at the Kybele Hotel, and its warmth and charm were so magnetic that for our January 2010 visit, we decided to stay there. We got a great off-season rate of $90 a day (inclusive of taxes). Cute room on the back side, with private balcony, one of 16 rooms. Free breakfast each morning includes hard boiled eggs, fresh bread, cheeses & meats, cereal, juice and coffee... Pleased that not only is the public area decorated with so many Turkish lanterns, but so are the rooms. Absolutely quaint, friendly, centrally located in Sultanahmet neighborhood, near mosques, Grand Bazaar... Wireless is free in lobby; there are also computers in the lobby for guest use. Friendly atmosphere all around... Couldn't have had a better experience. One of the finest, coolest, sweetest boutique hotels I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Location Plus Ambience - Hard to Beat”
Reviews.Author: Domrcpl
Reviews.Content: I am very glad that I listened to a friend's advice to stay in the Kybele Hotel in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. The hotel is quite literally steps away from the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Basilica Cistern. A few more steps away and you are in the Grand Bazaar, or in the Spice Bazaar, or on the dock to board a cruise boat on the Bosphorus Strait, or on the Galata Bridge. For efficiency in sightseeing, you can't beat this location especially if you only have 2 and a half days as we did. As for the Kybele Hotel itself, it is hard not to be taken in by its character. The hotel is tastefully decorated and distinctive because of the 4,000 colorful lamps that adorn all the ceilings - yes, that includes your bedroom. The lounge is a very welcoming oasis where you can just sit, drink tea, and reflect on the awe-inspiring city that is Istanbul. The service is very friendly and efficient. The rooms are smallish but clean and comfortable and they do not have televisions. But if you are a serious tourist in Istanbul, you probably won't spend much time in your room nor would you be watching TV anyway. I would recommend this hotel very highly. And while in Istanbul, do indulge in the sweets that abound.

Reviews.Title: “Must visit hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sheremeta
Reviews.Content: The Kybele hotel is famous for its unique atmosphere, plenty of Turkish lamps everywhere (in each and every room), cozy furniture and great staff. It's also very well located in the heart of old Istanbul (Sophia, Blue Mosque etc. are about 1-2 minutes to walk). If you really want to feel the nature of Istanbul the Kybele art hotel is the best choice, trust me ))

Reviews.Title: “A very tasteful Hotel â€“ and a superfriendly owner”
Reviews.Author: ananda13
Reviews.Content: The Kybele is famous for its lamps. All rooms have a special light, due to 50 or more Lamps per room on the floor. The Lobby and the Cafe are also very tasteful with loads of old things like grammophon, old cameras, books and so on. The basic colour inside is red, the outside walls are green, blue â€“ all very colourful. They have a very beautiful bibliothek in tibetan-gypsy-style and the owner, Maik, is a very friendly turkish guy married with a german, talking very good english and even german. You can always have a tea with him. The breakfast is pretty good and the staff are okay, The Hotel is very close to Hagiasophia, although it is not in the typical Hotel Area. Only a few meters away is the Cayaoyglu Hamam or what was the name? Well, try it, it is not everybodys favorite kind of massage. All in all â€“ a special Hotel with a nice owner.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything and has Character”
Reviews.Author: DAGdesignHI
Reviews.Content: What a one of a kind decorating scheme, lamps everywhere. I had flight problems and they were very accomodating with my transport from the airport when I telephoned them and there was no problem with English. The room had air conditioning and enough room to feel comfortable spending time in. There was room for the two of us, our suitcases, and some extra furniture on our first stay and the second stay we had a suite with a balcony which was wonderful. Everyone was so helpful and the choice of different food for breakfast was great. It was near everything and the staff was helpful with recommendations and directions. They always said hello and upon our return from the rest of the trip took the time to ask how it was and what we saw and were glad to see us back. In a large city it is great to have such an experience and place to return too.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, fantastic location"”
Reviews.Author: WiseWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kybele for three nights when I squeezed in a fun trip at the back end of a work trip that took me through Istanbul. I sent an email inquiring into the room rates and their staff got back to me within an hour or so. The room was incredibly affordable. I had an added complication because my flight from Central Asia got me into Istanbul at 6:45am. Most hotels wouldn't let me check in until apx 3pm, but Kybele had a room available and allowed me to check in at 7:30am right when I got to the hotel for no added cost. This was a life-saver! They were also very helpful in arranging airport transfers both ways. And I loved the free wireless throughout the hotel. I've seen some criticisms on here about the rooms being small. My room was small, but this is kind of what you come to expect traveling throughout Europe and especially with a hotel offering such good rates and so incredibly well situated. Still, I had a double bed and even with my 2 gigantic suitcases and my carry-on bag, I was fine. Literally every monument in Sultanahmet is within a 3-block walk of the hotel. Very convenient. The rooms were very neat, there was a complimentary self-serve breakfast, and the common areas of the hotel are so beautiful you will find yourself taking many photos of them. I highly highly highly recommend this place unless you require tons and tons of space.

Reviews.Title: “top notch in service and flair”
Reviews.Author: JuniperPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: As a frequent international business traveler, it is always a welcome relief to find an interesting place to stay. The decor, antiques, colors, textures, and hanging lanterns from the ceilings create an beautiful and peaceful atmosphere. This family run hotel exemplifies Istanbul and its history of east meets west (for example, the combination of antique furniture and recently made recycled glass lanterns). The service is fantastic....I was offered tea each time I passed through the living room, the internet services works (!), and I was given much advice on how to maneuver through the bazaar. Yes, the rooms are small, but it is Europe and the lanterns hanging from the ceilings more than compensate for this (I would turn off the regular lights and simply stare at the array of colors and details in the lanterns at night). I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking to engage in their surroundings. This is one of the coolest places I've ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “rip off costs for antique and tack fake with location !”
Reviews.Author: turkishdlite27
Reviews.Content: yes the kybele has a plethora of lanterns and decorative suspect antique nik naks however the small DOUBLE room is too small even for a single eunuch...booking through discount agents is still extremely high and the breakfast compared to other much cheaper 4* hotels is pathetic.The staff are arrogant and more interested in each other.The other rooms are DOUBLE the price for enough room to swing a kitten. All hotels in sultanamet have the location factor and roof top views.Stay anywhere else you can unpack and not scrape your knees going to the toilet. Spend your cash on a rug per day for the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: drnorth
Reviews.Content: I saw the pictures of the Kybele on the website and i knew i had to stay there. It looked so beautiful with its rich colors, lanterns and cozy clutter of antiques. It was even better in person. The decor is the real star here - it is ridiculously charming from the rooms to the lobby to the little hidden library and garden. My room was so beautiful that i didn't want to leave. It was tiny, but perfect. The staff were great. The owner is delightful. Breakfast was wonderful. The location is terrific, right next to the Aya Sofia. It is a very romantic hotel, but even as a solo traveler i appreciated this atmosphere. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chiquita2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fantastic time. The staff was friendly, the food was great and the rooms were unique. Our room was small and the shower would be considered tight by many but the hotel is so unique that I'd highly recommend it. It has all of these antique lamps hanging for the ceilings all over the hotel (even your room). The downstairs/breakfast area is furnished with antique furniture and open for all to enjoy. They even have a little library of book which you're permitted to use.

HotelInfo.Name: Kybele Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Yerebatan Caddesi 35 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
